page.title: 02WOODNESBOROUGH CHURCH
page.content: Woodnesborough church was built in 1180.In the church there is a very colourful Creation window given to the church by A Man of Kent.It was made by a man named F.W Cole,who is in charge of all the stained glass windows in Canterbury Cathedral,for the Queen's Jubilee in 1978. On the pillars in the church there are markings which are thought to be pilgrims markings. From the top of the tower we could see Ash tower,Worth tower and St Peter's church tower in Sandwich.By lining up the towers in Sandwich and Woodnesboro' ships at sea knew when to turn in to Sandwich harbour.In the churchyard we were shown the body-stone of the giant of Woodnesborough it took up the length of two children.In the church are two grave-markers which pre-date the Norman Conquest. It is thought that Woden was worshipped here in pagan times.
